;;《王冠》中，Fflyn Edwards 饰演哈里王子，Elizabeth Debicki 饰演戴安娜，Rufus Kampa 饰演威廉王子。
;

;《王冠》的创作者表示，包括朱迪·丹奇夫人和约翰·梅杰爵士在内的《王冠》的批评者在观看该剧后一定会感到“相当愚蠢”。

;

;在 Netflix 热门剧集第六季开播前英国王室的编剧兼剧作家彼得·摩根表示，他从未创作过任何引起公众如此愤怒的作品。节目即将上映，”;摩根告诉 Variety;。 “当它发布的那一刻，人们看到它——无论是朱迪·丹奇还是约翰·梅杰——他们立即陷入沉默。我认为他们可能觉得自己很愚蠢。”

;

;去年倒数第二季上映前，丹奇指责该剧“粗俗煽情”，而梅杰则将其中的一些场景描述为“恶意的胡言乱语”。作为回应，Netflix 附上了;“虚构戏剧化”免责声明< /a>; 在该剧的预告片上。

;

;摩根表示，在英国很难就《王冠》进行合理的对话。 “英国的每个人，无论他们是否承认，对这个家庭都有一定程度的敏感和依恋，这就是为什么它绝对是剧作家探索的雷区。然而剧作家生来就是为了写国王和王后的。这就是我们所做的。”

;

;该系列的第六部分也是最后一部分将分两部分发布，第一部分将于 11 月 16 日发布，第二部分将于 12 月 14 日发布。它将涵盖 1997 年威尔士王妃戴安娜和多迪·法耶德在巴黎车祸中丧生、2002 年金禧纪念日以及 2005 年查尔斯王子和卡米拉·帕克·鲍尔斯的婚礼。

; ;

;曾两次获得奥斯卡编剧奖提名（《女王》和《弗罗斯特/尼克松》）并多次获得艾美奖、金球奖和英国电影和电视艺术学院奖的摩根表示，他有信心比现在早近二十年停止这部剧是“有尊严的”。

;

;他说他有一个关于前传的想法，可以早于伊丽莎白二世，但它“需要一系列独特的环境来实现” ”。

;

;编剧说，去年九月伊丽莎白二世去世时，他几乎完成了最后一季的创作，他改变了结局以承认她的去世。

;

;“我们都愿意经历过葬礼。因此，由于每个人都会有如此深刻的感受，我必须尝试找到一种方法，在最后一集处理角色的死亡，即使她还没有死。”

;

;摩根说他避免阅读哈里王子的回忆录《备用》，因为他不想让王子的声音“过多地占据我的思考”。

;

;他说：“我非常同情他，非常同情。但我不想读他的书。”

;

;他还谈到了媒体对 ;戴安娜的鬼魂在即将到来的一季中出现;，表示她的出现从来没有打算是超自然的。

;

;“这是她继续生活清晰地浮现在她留下的人们的脑海里。戴安娜是独一无二的，我想这就是激励我找到一种独特的方式来代表她的原因。她在叙事上值得特殊对待。”他说。

;

;摩根表示，他对第五季中的“Tampongate”一集并不感到内疚，该集涉及查尔斯和卡米拉之间的亲密对话，并称这是“故事”隐私被破坏……而不是剥削的故事”。

; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 21:22:01 +0800 Polish president delays appointing new governmenthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/26/polish-president-delays-appointing-new-government

;
;;总统府外的抗议者。左起第三个白色横幅上写着“杜达总统，立即将权力交给反对派”，其他标牌上写着“杜达总统，立即将权力交给反对派”，“流氓和小偷的政府”，“不要一头猪，别拖延！”、“杜达先生，长大了，别拖延”、“让我们将法律与正义党从波兰的公共生活中清除”。
;

;波兰总统不会召集新议会直到近一个月后，三路反对派联盟赢得了绝对多数，这可能会将新政府的组建推迟到12月。

;

;安杰伊·杜达(Andrzej Duda)，与执政的民族主义法律和正义联盟结盟PiS 党表示，他将在 11 月 13 日召开新议会第一次会议，并于稍后宣布他对总理候选人的提名。

;

;PiS 在 10 月 15 日的投票中获得第一名，但没有可行的方案前总理兼欧洲理事会主席唐纳德·图斯克领导的反对派联盟本周确认了其多数席位，并且 ;表示已准备好掌权;。

; <图斯克周四在布鲁塞尔发表讲话时表示，最好不要拖延任命新政府的过程，因为波兰需要迅速采取行动，以确保获得欧盟资金，这些资金因法治而被冻结

;

;“如果总统迅速承认议会拥有多数席位的现实并允许其组建政府，我保证这将意味着快速向波兰支付资金，”图斯克对记者表示.

;

;根据波兰宪法，总统在选举日起 30 天内召集新议会，并在另外 14 天内提名总理候选人，该候选人必须组建内阁，并在选举日进行信任投票。

;

;杜达周四表示：“我可以说，议会下院第一次会议的初步日期将为 11 月 13 日星期一，考虑到宪法规范，这是最快的日期。” ”

;

;他表示，总理一职有两位“认真的候选人”，即现任总理马特乌什·莫拉维茨基和图斯克，并补充说波兰面临着需要进一步反思的“新形势”。

;

; >;

;

;杜达此前曾表示，他打算遵循传统，提名赢得最多选票的政党的候选人。 PiS 以 36% 的选票获胜，但反对派联盟在 460 个席位的议会中拥有 248 席的明显多数。

;

;由于 PiS 似乎没有获得多数席位的途径，因此预计会失去多数席位。信任投票，届时国会议员可以自由提名自己的总理候选人，但这一延迟可能意味着新政府要到 12 月才能到位。

;

;总统会见了五国领导人“第三条道路”的西蒙·霍洛尼亚 (Szymon Hołownia) 表示，他周二和周三在新议会中与各党派进行了会面，并明确表示他不会仓促行事。“第三条道路”是图斯克公民联盟和左翼反对派联盟的一部分。

;

;“总统明确表示他可能会在最后一刻召开第一次会议； “他使用了他不想缩短本届议会任期的措辞，”霍洛尼亚在与总统会谈后说道。

; ;

;PiS 批评者认为杜达可能故意拖延这一进程。一些人认为 PiS 可能试图说服个别反对派议员支持尽管它似乎不太可能赢得所需的 37 名国会议员。其他人则认为，法律与公正党可能只是想让新政府的生活尽可能困难，或者可能是为了争取时间来摆脱潜在的议员。涉嫌在职非法行为的罪证。

;

;;各种反对领导人此前曾暗示;几位法律与正义党高级人物，包括杜达、莫拉维茨基和前总理贝塔·西德沃，一旦新政府就位，可能会面临国家法庭的审判。

;

;权力，法律与正义党;侵蚀了波兰的法治;，取消堕胎权，并通过仇恨宣传针对少数群体，引发了与欧盟在司法独立和 LGBTQ+ 权利等问题上的争执。

; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 21:22:01 +0800 The Beatles: ‘final’ song Now and Then to be released thanks to AI technologyhttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/26/the-beatles-final-song-now-and-then-ai-technology
;;2023-10-26T13:00:35Z;
;
;;1968 年的披头士乐队。
;

;时不时地，期待已久的“最终”披头士乐队这首由所有四位成员演唱的歌曲将于下周发布，这要归功于彼得·杰克逊的纪录片《Get Back》中用于增强音频的相同人工智能技术。

;

;“就是这样，约翰的声音晶莹剔透， ”保罗·麦卡特尼在一份声明中说道。 “这真是太感人了。我们都用它演奏，这是真正的披头士乐队录音。 2023 年，仍然致力于披头士乐队的音乐，并即将发行一首公众还没有听过的新歌，我认为这是一件令人兴奋的事情。”

;

;《Now and Then》由约翰·列侬创作并演唱。 20 世纪 70 年代末，他在纽约市达科他大楼的家中。 1994 年，列侬的遗孀小野洋子 (Yoko Ono) 在标有“For Paul”的磁带上向保罗·麦卡特尼 (Paul McCartney) 提供了该小样，其中还包括列侬的《Free As a Bird》和《Real Love》的小样。

;

;而后者的歌曲是由麦卡特尼完成的、林戈·斯塔尔和乔治·哈里森，并作为披头士乐队选集项目的一部分作为单曲发行，技术限制意味着列侬在《Now and Then》中的人声和钢琴无法与其他三名披头士乐队录制的新部分分开工作，而且搁置。

; ;

; 超过四分之一个世纪后，杰克逊使用人工智能辅助软件对迈克尔·林赛·霍格 (Michael Lindsay-Hogg) 1970 年披头士乐队录制最后一张专辑《Let It Be》的片段中的原始音频进行了分离，以隔离乐器、人声和对话，并将音频和图像制作成;《回归纪录片》; 系列。

;

;该技术随后被用于在 2022 年制作 Revolver 的新混音，并激励幸存的乐队成员重新审视列侬的 Now and then 演示。杰克逊和埃米尔·德拉雷 (Emile de la Rey) 领导的音响团队使用相同的技术将列侬最初的声乐表演与他的钢琴分离。

;

;斯塔尔在一份声明中说：“这是我们最接近的一次。他回到了房间，所以我们所有人都非常激动。你知道，就像约翰就在那里一样。麦卡特尼和斯塔尔为这首歌创作了新的部分，其中吉他部分由哈里森于 1995 年录制，弦乐编曲由麦卡特尼、贾尔斯·马丁和本·福斯特创作。埃莉诺·里格比 (Eleanor Rigby) 和《因为》(Because) 的原版唱片《Here、There 和 Everywhere》中的伴唱已融入到这首新歌中。 Jeff Lynne 贡献了额外的制作。

;

;6 月，;麦卡特尼告诉 BBC 广播电台 4;，人工智能已被用来从盒式录音中“解救”列侬的声音。 “我们能够通过人工智能获取约翰的声音并使其纯净，”他说。 “然后我们可以像平常一样对唱片进行混音。它给了你某种回旋余地。”

; ;

;他的言论引发了人们对人工智能被用来人为地再生列侬表演的某些方面的担忧。 ;麦卡特尼随后扩展了“混乱和猜测”，并澄清说：“现阶段不能说太多，但要明确的是，没有任何东西是人为或综合创造的。这一切都是真实的，我们都在玩它。我们清理了一些现有的录音——这个过程已经持续了多年。我们希望您和我们一样喜欢这首歌。”

;

;这首歌将在一部 13 分钟的纪录片中介绍其制作过程，该纪录片于格林威治标准时间 11 月 1 日星期三晚上 7 点 30 分首播，并于 11 月 2 日完整发布。 11 月 3 日，它将与披头士乐队 1962 年首张单曲《Love Me Do》一起作为双 A 面单曲发行，封面艺术由 ;流行艺术家 Ed Ruscha;。

;

;《Now and Then》的存在对粉丝来说并不奇怪。 1997 年，麦卡特尼告诉 Q 杂志，它已被搁置，因为哈里森“不喜欢它”。

;

;“它没有一个很好的标题，需要进行一些修改，但它有一个优美的诗句，约翰也唱过，”他说。 “[但是]乔治不喜欢它。披头士乐队是一个民主国家，我们没有这样做。” ;麦卡特尼后来向《纽约客》澄清< /a>; 哈里森称列侬的演示为“他妈的垃圾”。

;
;

;;相关：;;从整理粉丝邮件到看到 Abbey Road 的存在制作：我作为甲壳虫乐队青少年员工的生活;

;
;

;哈里森的遗孀奥利维亚·哈里森 (Olivia Harrison) 在一份声明中说道：“早在 1995 年，在录音室为这首歌工作了几天之后，乔治认为演示的技术问题是无法克服的，并得出结论，不可能以足够高的标准完成赛道。如果他今天在这里，[儿子] Dhani 和我知道他会全心全意地与 Paul 和 Ringo 一起完成《Now and Then》的录制。”

;

;列侬的儿子 Sean Ono Lennon 也评论了这首歌曲的制作曲目，说：“在父亲去世多年后听到他们一起工作真是令人难以置信。这是我爸爸、保罗、乔治和林戈一起制作的最后一首歌。它就像一个时间胶囊，一切感觉都是命中注定的。”

;

;《Now and Then》的实体发行也先于被称为“红色专辑”和“蓝色专辑”的合辑的新版本发布，扩展至涵盖了披头士乐队的全部单曲唱片，其中 Red 增加了 12 首歌曲，Blue 增加了 9 首歌曲。

; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 19:52:01 +0800 Mike Johnson as speaker shows ‘Maga is ascendant’ in Congress, Matt Gaetz sayshttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/26/mike-johnson-speaker-matt-gaetz-maga-ascendant
;;2023-10-26T11:18:15Z;
;
;;Matt Gaetz stands to vote for Mike Johnson in the House Chamber on 25 October.
;

;Mike Johnson's ascent to be speaker of the US House of Representatives proves Donald Trump dominates the Republican party and “Maga is ascendant”, the Florida congressman Matt Gaetz ;said;, using an acronym for Trump's campaign slogan, Make America great again.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Election denier, climate skeptic, anti-abortion: seven beliefs of new US House speaker Mike Johnson;

;
;

;“The swamp is on the run, Maga is ascendant and if you don't think that moving from Kevin McCarthy to Maga Mike Johnson shows the ascendance of this movement, and where the power of the Republican party truly lies, then you're not paying attention,” Gaetz ;told; the former Trump campaign chair and White House strategist Steve Bannon on his podcast on Wednesday.

;

;Gaetz precipitated three weeks of leaderless chaos inside the Republican party, and therefore the House, when he triggered the removal of McCarthy this month. Seven other Republicans voted to make McCarthy the first speaker ever ejected by his own party but Gaetz orchestrated the move.

;

;First Steve Scalise of Louisiana, then Jim Jordan of Ohio, then Tom Emmer of Minnesota won internal votes but failed to win sufficient support on the House floor.

;

;Some pundits thought Jordan's failure indicated a waning of Trump's influence, given the Ohioan's longstanding prominence on the extreme right of the party. But on Tuesday, Trump dynamited Emmer's hopes with a brutal statement.

;

;The party then moved fast to select Johnson, a low-profile Louisiana lawmaker who nonetheless played a central role in Trump's attempt to overturn the 2020 election and whose policy positions, and past as a lawyer for ;anti-LGBTQ+; and ;creationist; causes, puts him on the hard right of the party.

;

;Despite facing 91 criminal charges and assorted civil threats, Trump maintains huge leads in polling regarding the Republican presidential nomination next year.

;

;Gaetz, a dedicated rabble-rouser ;facing; a House ethics investigation over allegations of sexual misconduct and misuse of funds, is reported to be targeting a run for governor of Florida.

;

;On Wednesday, Jeff Timmer, a former Republican operative now an adviser to the anti-Trump Lincoln Project, assessed Gaetz's claim that “Maga is ascendant” and ;said;: “It's strange to say, but Matt Gaetz is correct about this.”

;

;Gaetz told Bannon Johnson was “sharp” and would be “as respected in the homes of our most meaningful, righteous and patriotic donors as he will at the rallies with our most enthusiastic and meaningful activists.

;

;“… They are crying, they are hand-wringing, they are bed-wetting over on K Street” – the centre of the lobbying industry in Washington DC – “because we have an honorable, righteous man who is about to take this position. He's going to do great things for the country.”

;

;On Tuesday night, when Johnson announced that he was set to become speaker, a reporter asked him about his role in Trump's election subversion.

;

;The Louisianan was one of 147 Republicans who voted to object to results in key states even after the deadly January 6 riot. He also authored an amicus brief to the US supreme court in a case which aimed to have results thrown out, attracting 125 supporters.

;

;At the Capitol, Johnson smiled and shook his head while Republicans around him ;booed and jeered;.

;

;“Shut up,” said Virginia Foxx, 80, from North Carolina. “Shut up.”

;

;Johnson said: “Next question.”

; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 19:52:01 +0800 Sandro Tonali: Italian FA agrees 10-month ban for Newcastle footballerhttps://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/oct/26/sandro-tonali-newcastle-banned-10-month-over-betting
;;2023-10-26T11:01:28Z;
;
;;Sandro Tonali reflects on Newcastle's defeat by Borussia Dortmund on Wednesday
;

;The Newcastle midfielder Sandro Tonali will be banned from football for 10 months for breaking Italian gambling regulations, the president of the Italian football federation (FIGC) has said. Gabriele Gravina said Tonali would also undergo an eight-month rehabilitation period as part of the agreement.

;

;Tonali's agent has said his client has a gambling addiction and that Tonali cooperated fully with an Italian investigation. Tonali admitted to placing bets on matches, including some in which he was involved for Milan. He signed for Newcastle from Milan for £55m in July.

;

;Professional footballers in Italy are prohibited from betting on any competition organised by Fifa, Uefa or the FIGC. Doing so is punishable with a three-year ban, though this may be reduced with a guilty plea.

; ;

;“The FIGC prosecutor and Tonali have reached an agreement which I have already approved,” Gravina said. “The agreement consists of a 10-month ban plus eight months of rehab activities and at least 16 public appearances.”

;

;Tonali's lawyer was in Italy this week to negotiate a plea bargain for the 23-year-old, who has been ;promised his club's full support;. Newcastle's manager, Eddie Howe, said last Friday: “We will throw our arms around Sandro and protect him and try to give him the love and support he needs to find solutions to the problems he's had. ; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 19:22:01 +0800 UK regulator trying to block release of Shell North Sea documentshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/oct/26/uk-regulator-trying-block-release-shell-north-sea-documents

;
;;The Brent Bravo oil platform is transported into the mouth of the River Tees for decommissioning in June 2019
;

;The UK's oil and gas regulator is coming under fire from environmental groups for using lawyers to try to prevent the publication of five key documents relating to the environmental impact of Shell's activities in the North Sea.

;

;At a hearing in December, a legal representative for the North Sea Transition Authority (NSTA) is expected to argue against the publication of documents that contain details about the risk of pollution as a result of decommissioning the Brent oilfield, which was operated by Shell for more than 40 years. It says it opposes publication “on a matter of process basis”.

;

;Shell has applied for an exemption from international rules that require all infrastructure to be removed from the field and the UK government is deciding whether it will allow the oil company to leave the 170-metre high oil platform legs in place for the three platforms known as Bravo, Charlie and Delta.

;

;A total of 64 concrete storage cells are contained in the leg structures, 42 of which have previously been used for oil storage and separation.

;

;Most of the cells are the size of seven Olympic swimming pools, and collectively ;still contain an estimated 72,000 tonnes of contaminated sediment; and 638,000 cubic metres of oily water.

;

;Environmental groups believe the documents held by the NSTA would reveal new information about long-term environmental dangers that is relevant to other North Sea oil developments, including ;Equinor's plans to develop Rosebank;, the UK's largest untapped field.

;

;The five documents that the hearing relates to include updated versions of the field decommissioning programme and the field's environmental appraisal, as well as technical documents relating to radioactive sediment and toxic drill cuttings.

;

;Earlier versions of all five documents were published as part of the consultation process in 2016 and 2017 and, according to a statement published by the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO), the more recent versions have been updated to reflect further consultations that have taken place.

;

;The documents include the decommissioning proposals for the installations, details about the substances contained within the cells, and research relating to the potential environmental impact of these substances over the short and long term.

;

;Lang Banks, the director of the conservation group WWF Scotland, said: “It's an absolute farce that the regulator is spending public money on lawyers to try and prevent the release of documents that should have been made publicly available a long time ago.

;

;“If they are prepared to use these documents as part of the planning and the licensing process then they should also be prepared to make them public.”

;

;Tessa Khan, an international climate crisis and human rights lawyer and the executive director of the campaign group Uplift, believes the regulator's efforts to keep the documents out of the public domain are for the benefit of the oil and gas industry and at the expense of the environment and general public.

;

;“The NSTA's job is to act as an independent regulator but, for as long as it's been around, it has favoured oil and gas firms, including colluding with the industry on how to best sell new drilling to the public,” ;she told Sky News;.

;

;“Perhaps it's not surprising given that ex-oil and gas executives sit on the NSTA's board and some of its members still hold shares in the industry.”

;

;The regulator was first asked to publish the documents by the investigative journalism organisation ;Point Source; in July 2022 in a request made under the Freedom of Information Act and the Environmental Information Regulations.

;

;In September that year, the NSTA said it had consulted Shell and subsequently decided it did not have the authority to release the documents as they were held on behalf of a third party that had not consented to the documents being released.

;

;In May 2023, the ICO issued a decision saying the NSTA's failure to respond appropriately to the request within legal time limits was “unacceptable” and had violated the Environmental Information Regulations.

;

;The ICO then ordered the regulator to either publish the documents or give a valid legal reason for not supplying them within 35 days. The NSTA has not published the documents and will argue its case to a judge in a hearing in December.

;

;Some campaign groups have said they believe the latest legal appeal launched by the NSTA is a tactic designed to prevent the environmental information from surfacing at a sensitive time for the government.

;

;The case will be heard by the General Regulatory Chamber, which is responsible for handling appeals against decisions made by government regulatory bodies.

;

;Last month, the NSTA sparked outrage from environmental campaigners when it ;gave the go-ahead to develop the Rosebank oil and gas field;, which lies off Shetland.

;

;The government also ;recently launched a new licensing round; to allow oil and gas companies to explore for fossil fuels in the North Sea.

;

;Robin Wells, the director of the campaign group Fossil Free London, said: “It is crucial that the regulator shares new information that it has about the environmental impact of existingoilfields so that informed decisions can be made about whether to develop more fields.”

;

;;The previously published environmental assessment documents; said there was a significant degree of uncertainty about the environmental impact of Shell abandoning the remains of the Brent platforms in the North Sea.

;

;They noted that one of the areas of uncertainty was the best way to deal with the contaminated contents of the cells as the levels of radioactivity were “currently unknown”.

;

;The documents said only very limited samples were taken from the contaminated sediments.

;

;Samples were just taken from the top 50cm of sediment in three of the 64 cells and only 6kg of sediment and 10 litres of water were tested from the estimated tens of millions of kilograms of sediment and hundreds of millions of litres of oily water.

;

;The previously published documents said 261kg of mercury could be released and that the toxic substance phenanthrene could chemically affect the seabed over an area of 1.7 sq km as pollutants started to leak from the decaying concrete cells.

;

;The documents also said a significant portion of the oil released with cell water was predicted to reach the sea surface, where it could affect seabirds.

;

;In 2019, the publicly available environmental assessment documents were heavily criticised by Germany and other EU member states who said Shell's assessment of the potential for environmental damage was too conservative. They ;said the remaining oil and pollutants were a “ticking timebomb”;.

;

;;A report commissioned by the German government; said the methodology used by Shell in its publicly available environmental impact assessments was “fundamentally flawed” and contained a “high level of mathematical bias”.

;

;A spokesperson for the NSTA said: “The responsibility for the decommissioning decisions and the environmental assessments are not in the NSTA's remit, but are for the Offshore Petroleum Regulator for Environment and Decommissioning (OPRED). The NSTA is appealing [against] the decision of the ICO to disclose certain information on a matter of process basis.”

;

;In a statement, Shell said: “Our recommendations are the result of 10 years of research, involving more than 300 scientific and technical studies. We established an independent group of scientific experts to review the findings and ensure all feasible decommissioning options were investigated thoroughly.”

;

;The oil company added: “Shell submits documents as part of a process which is tightly controlled by the regulator, in full knowledge that they will be published in due course. The manner and timing of this is a matter for the regulator.”

; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 18:22:02 +0800 Pigeons problem-solve similarly to artificial intelligence, research showshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/oct/26/pigeons-smart-ai-learning
;;2023-10-26T09:00:30Z;
;
;;一只鸽子对着镜头怒目而视
;

;一个新的 ;研究;发现鸽子解决问题的方式与人工智能相匹配。

;

;经常被忽视令人讨厌的是，鸽子实际上是非常聪明的动物，它们可以记住面孔，以鲜艳的色彩看到世界，导航复杂的路线，传递新闻，甚至;拯救生命;。

;
;

;;相关：;;研究发现，公鸡可能能够识别自己的倒影;

;
;

;在这项研究中，24 只鸽子被赋予了各种视觉任务，其中一些它们在几天内学会了分类，而另一些则在几周内学会了分类。研究人员发现证据表明，鸽子用来做出正确选择的机制与人工智能模型用来做出正确预测的方法非常相似。

;

;“鸽子的行为表明，大自然已经创造了一种高度精确的算法。该研究的合著者、爱荷华大学实验心理学教授爱德华·沃瑟曼（Edward Wasserman）说：“它可以有效地学习非常具有挑战性的任务。” “不一定要以最快的速度，但要保持高度的一致性。”

;

;在屏幕上，鸽子会受到不同的刺激，例如不同宽度、位置和方向的线条，以及分段环和同心环。每只鸟必须啄一下右侧或左侧的按钮来决定它们属于哪一类。如果他们猜对了，他们就会得到颗粒状的食物；如果猜对了，他们就会得到颗粒状的食物。如果他们做错了，他们就一无所获。

;

;“鸽子不需要规则，”该研究的主要作者、俄亥俄州立大学心理学教授布兰登·特纳说。相反，他们通过反复试验来学习。例如，当他们看到一个视觉效果时，比如“A 类”，任何看起来接近的东西都会被他们归类为“A 类”，从而发挥他们识别相似性的能力。

;

;通过实验，鸽子在处理一些较简单的任务时做出正确选择的能力从 55% 提高到 95%。面对更复杂的挑战，它们的准确率从 55% 提高到 68%。

;

;“使用鸽子等更卑微的动物，我们可以测试它们能够走多远，[我们认为]波鸿鲁尔大学行为神经科学教授 Onur Güntürkün 没有参与这项研究，他说：“完全或大部分是联想。” “这篇论文展示了联想系统有多么强大，它们是多么真实的认知。”

;

;在人工智能模型中，主要目标是识别模式并做出决策。研究表明，鸽子也能做到这一点。从后果中学习，当没有给予食物颗粒时，鸽子具有非凡的纠正错误的能力。相似性函数也对鸽子起作用，通过利用它们寻找两个物体之间相似性的能力。

;

;“仅凭这两种机制，您就可以定义一个神经网络或人工智能机器来基本上解决这些问题分类问题，”特纳说。 “按理说，人工智能中存在的机制也存在于鸽子中。”

;

;研究人员现在的目标是与研究鸽子及其大脑的科学家合作。他们希望这些发现能够在更好地了解人类大脑损伤方面具有实际应用。

;

;也许我们可以进一步了解小鸟大脑中发生的情况，”Wasserman 说。 “这是一个非常好的大脑——它的尺寸可能很小，但在学习能力方面却具有强大的力量。”

;

;在研究过程中没有鸽子受到伤害。
